intro: Achyrocalyx decaryi, commonly known as the Congo hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is often found in the understory of rainforests, where it contributes to the biodiversity of the ecosystem. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
